New Records: Jose Quintana has not allowed an earned run in three consecutive postseason starts, which is tied for the second-longest such streak in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Jose Quintana pitched five strong innings in which he let up two hits and only was done in by a misplay by Mark Vientos.
Francisco Lindor’s sixth-inning grand slam ensured Quintana would not be the hard-luck loser.
Pre-Game Insights: Quintana said after the game: “I always think: Just go out there and do my job.”
Post-Match Reflections: Quintana said: “When the team needs you, for me to be here and do my job and feel confident with all my stuff, it’s amazing.”
Quintana said: “I’m really glad to be a part of this group.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets will move on to the NLCS for the first time since 2015.
